description: From Middle English absterse, from Latin abstersus, perfect passive participle of abstergeō (“wipe off, wipe away”); formed from abs- + tergeō (“wipe”).

verbs.description: absterse (third-person singular simple present absterses, present participle abstersing, simple past and past participle abstersed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare) To absterge; to cleanse; to purge away. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
